item.title: Remembering the Bagdad Inn Las Vegas: A Roadside Icon's History
item.description:
A Desert Oasis for Road Trippers: The Bagdad Inn’s Beginnings

For decades, the Bagdad Inn stood as a familiar and comforting landmark on Las Vegas Boulevard South. Located near Sahara Avenue, this roadside motel perfectly embodied the spirit of 1950s Las Vegas â€“ a city rapidly expanding to cater to the burgeoning automobile tourism boom. Built during a pivotal era of American travel, the Bagdad Inn was designed specifically for the road tripper, a vital demographic fueling Vegas’s growth. It offered a haven of simple comfort and affordability, a far cry from the opulent casinos that were beginning to define the Strip.
